and David Archuleta , 17, each performed three times in the live telecast before some 7000 people at Los Angeles' Nokia Theatre. One song was chosen for each by Sony BMG executive Clive Davis , who assigned U2's I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For to Cook, and the Elton John ballad "Don't Let the Sun Go Down on Me" to David Archuleta . Simon Cowell , who had earlier predicted Cook would triumph, firmly stated "Round 1 goes to David Archuleta ."

responsibility in the company. Earlier all the major strategic decisions were taken by the three of them together. But that is set to change. In a self-authored blogpost Eric Schmidt details about the new roles, Larry will now lead product development and technology strategy, his greatest strengths, and starting from April 4 he will take charge of our day-to-day operations as Google's Chief Executive Officer. In this new role I know he will merge Google's technology and business vision brilliantly. I am enormously proud of my last decade as CEO, and I am certain that the next 10 years under Larry will be even better! Larry, in my clear opinion, is ready to lead. Eric Schmidt describes co-founder Sergey Brin as an "innovator and entrepreneur to the core" and rightly so, his role in new and strategic projects would be much needed. He would continue to sport the "co-founder" title

Bill Lockyer , California's state treasurer, participated in a national telephonic news conference with EPI officials, to denounce the bankruptcy concept. No state needs to declare bankruptcy, Bill Lockyer said, "The states have sovereign taxing power the big companies don't." Bill Lockyer 's point- a valid one- is that bankruptcy is the refuge for individuals, corporations and local governments
